Major_Arcs.title: Nan and Ghost Town's Impending Change
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Nan's dissatisfaction with 'Ghost Town', the revelation of its planned demolition for an airport, and her initial emotional reactions and subsequent interactions with Cal.

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Discontent and Rejection in Ghost Town
sub_scenes.description: This scene introduces Nan and her dissatisfaction with life in 'Ghost Town', setting up her desires for a more glamorous and exciting life and her rejection of Cal's romantic advances.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Rejection and the Ghost Town Mystery
Cal's Frustrated Departure from Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: The Airport Project and Nan's Distress
sub_scenes.description: This scene reveals the impending transformation of 'Ghost Town' into an airport and focuses on Nan's shocked and emotional reaction to this news, highlighting her attachment to the town and her romanticized view of it.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Merrick Gulch and the 'Ghost Town' Label
Airport Development Plans for the Ghost Town
Nan's Distress and Realization of Ghost Town's Demolition

sub_scenes.title: Nan and Cal's Shifting Perspectives on the Airport
sub_scenes.description: This scene shows Nan's attempt to reconcile with Cal and present a practical view of the airport development, contrasting with his romantic ideals and her own previous romanticized view of 'Ghost Town'.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Apology and Practical View of the Airport
Nan's Reflection on Her Harsh Reaction to Cal
Cal's Cynical Monologue on Love and Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Hostile Encounter and Nan's Father's Ranch
sub_scenes.description: This scene introduces a threatening encounter with rough men, highlighting the changing and potentially dangerous atmosphere of 'Ghost Town' due to the impending development, and then transitions to Nan's domestic setting and conflict with her father.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with Rough Men and Nan's Resistance
Nan's Airport Frustration and Father's Dismissiveness
Horses for Construction and Father-Daughter Argument
Nan's Humiliation and Reflection in Bed

sub_scenes.title: Seeking Advice and Resolving to Act
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts Nan receiving advice from her mother, father, and maid regarding her relationship with Cal, leading to her decision to take action and clarify her feelings.

narrative_arcs.title: Mother's Advice on Love and Childishness
Father's Pragmatic Advice to Focus on Cal
Maid's Reassurance of Cal's Love and Need for Patience
Nan's Resolve to Know Cal's True Feelings
Horses Arriving and Ranch Hand's Request for Help
Argument with Father About a Deal

Major_Arcs.title: Nan and Cal's Romantic Resolution Amidst Crisis
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Nan and Cal's relationship reaching a resolution against the backdrop of the impending airport construction and a severe snowstorm, culminating in their reunion and a hopeful future.

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Confessions and Separation
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts Nan and Cal's emotional exchange, Cal's departure for work, and the mysterious stampede of horses, setting up a period of separation and uncertainty.

sub_scenes.title: Snowstorm and Community Crisis
sub_scenes.description: This scene establishes the severe weather conditions and the community's growing concern over the heavy snowfall and its impact on their resources and livestock.

sub_scenes.title: Despair, Hope, and Romantic Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This scene portrays the community's initial despair and then the sudden hope brought by the arrival of the plane carrying fodder, culminating in Nan and Cal's emotional resolution and a hopeful outlook on their future together.

narrative_arcs.title: Hope from the Sky: Arrival of the Plane

Major_Arcs.title: Chane Benson's Reputation and Confrontation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Chane Benson and the conflicting perceptions of his character, leading to a public confrontation and escalating tensions in the town.

sub_scenes.title: Public Spectacle and Skepticism
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts Chane Benson in a dramatic confrontation and the immediate skeptical reactions from the townspeople, questioning his heroic image and reputation.

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Fascination and Sally's Concern
sub_scenes.description: This scene introduces Sally's concern about Jeff's growing fascination with guns and violence, particularly his admiration for Chane Benson, setting up a conflict between Sally, Jeff, and the influence of Benson.

narrative_arcs.title: Ominous Advice and Mention of Violence

sub_scenes.title: Public Outcry and Office Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts the public reaction to an article criticizing Chane Benson, leading to a direct and threatening confrontation between Benson and the article's publisher, Clyde, in the newspaper office.

narrative_arcs.title: Public Discussion about Chane Benson's Reputation and Article
Confrontation and Warning in the Office
Clyde's Determination to Publish Articles Despite Threats
Public Reaction to Clyde's Articles and Jeff's Insight
Considering a Dinner Invitation for Chane Benson
Awkward Dinner and Jeff's Demonstration for Chane

sub_scenes.title: Moonlight Accusations and Violent Escalation
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts a tense moonlight confrontation between Sally and Chane, escalating accusations and threats, followed by Sally's angry confrontation with Jeff about his betrayal.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Accusation and Chane's Evasive Response
Escalating Accusations and Threat of Violence
Sally's Confrontation with Jeff about Betrayal
Sally's Outburst and Accusation of Manipulation

sub_scenes.title: Climax and Resolution of Chane Benson Conflict
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts the climax of the conflict with Chane Benson, including physical confrontation, Sally's emotional reaction, and Jeff's determined action to save Clyde, culminating in Chane Benson being driven out of town.

narrative_arcs.title: Realization of Danger and Urgent Action
Confrontation with the Editor and Townsmen
Flashback to Clarion Office - The Ticking Clock
Flashback - Uncertainty and Fear Behind the Door
Reflection on Family, Courage, and Decency

Major_Arcs.title: Betsy and Steve's Ranch Romance and Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the introduction of Steve Daley to Betsy, the emerging ranch conflict with Fred Bridges, and the developing romantic relationship between Betsy and Steve, tested by violence and Betsy's principles.

sub_scenes.title: Steve's Arrival and Ranch Introduction
sub_scenes.description: This scene introduces Steve Daley, his hiring by Hank Galloway, and his initial interactions with Betsy, foreshadowing ranch troubles and Betsy's initial reservations about Steve.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Steve Daley to Betsy
Confirmation of Hiring and Foreshadowing Trouble
Discussion about Steve's Character and Past
Journey to Town and Lingering Doubts

sub_scenes.title: Town Confrontation and Physical Fight
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts Betsy and Steve's arrival in town, their confrontation with Fred Bridges and his men, and the ensuing physical altercation where Steve demonstrates his gunfighting skills.

narrative_arcs.title: Leaving the Store and Betsy's Sarcasm
Aftermath of the Punch and Further Threat
Discussion on Gunfighters and Hornets' Nest

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Decision and Romantic Resolution with Steve
sub_scenes.description: This scene shows Betsy's internal conflict and her changing decisions regarding Steve, ultimately leading to a romantic resolution where Steve agrees to give up gunfighting for her love.

narrative_arcs.title: Hank's Understanding and Betsy's Romantic Feelings

sub_scenes.title: Land Dispute and Betsy's Confrontation at Devil's Pass
sub_scenes.description: This scene introduces a land dispute with Old Man Bridges and depicts Betsy and Steve's differing approaches to conflict resolution, culminating in Betsy taking charge and riding to Devil's Pass after recalling a past ambush.

narrative_arcs.title: Old Man Bridges' Complaint and Hank's Accusation
Betsy and Steve's Confrontation and Steve's Challenge to Hank
Betsy's Stand Against Gun Violence and Concern for Steve
Steve's Reflection on Past Mistakes and the Ambush
Betsy and Steve's Parting and Betsy's Worried Reflection

sub_scenes.title: Devil's Pass Resolution and Happy Ending
sub_scenes.description: This scene concludes the ranch conflict at Devil's Pass, depicting Betsy's recovery, her affectionate reunion with Steve, and their hopeful outlook on the future, resolving both the external conflict and their personal relationship tensions.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Devil's Pass and Ominous Recognition
Betsy's Recovery and Reassurance by Steve

Major_Arcs.title: Carrie, Dave, and Fred - Romantic Entanglements and Contract Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Carrie's romantic entanglements with Fred and Dave, the conflict arising from the Carlton contract, and her journey to understand Fred's true motivations, ultimately leading to a bittersweet resolution.

sub_scenes.title: Protecting Dave and Range Conflict Introduction
sub_scenes.description: This scene introduces Carrie's protective nature towards Dave and sets up the initial range conflict with the Bar 'C' ranch, creating a backdrop of personal and external conflicts.

narrative_arcs.title: Curley's Troubled Arrival and Range Conflict

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Range Tension and Gun Draw
sub_scenes.description: This scene escalates the range conflict with Fred Gordon's arrival and accusations regarding fencing, leading to a tense standoff and a gun being drawn, highlighting the immediate threat of violence.

narrative_arcs.title: Explaining the Fence and Herd Concerns
Fred Gordon's Polite but Tense Arrival

sub_scenes.title: Flashback and Conflicted Present Feelings
sub_scenes.description: This scene shifts between a flashback of past apology and present-day conflicted feelings of Carrie and Dave regarding Fred Gordon, exploring the complex emotional history between them.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie and Dave's Conflicted Feelings about Fred
Present Confrontation: Fred Gordon and Carrie

sub_scenes.title: Accusations, Confession, and Proposal Flashback
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts escalating accusations between Fred and Carrie, Dave's emotional intervention, Carrie's confession of feelings for Fred, and a flashback to Fred's romantic proposal to Carrie.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie's Confession and Dave's Attempt to Reconcile

sub_scenes.title: Contract Deceit and Carlton Office Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This scene reveals Fred's contract-driven proposal, Carrie's angry reaction and accusations of deceit, and her resolve to confront Mr. Carlton to resolve the contract issue.

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Resolution and Father's Comfort
sub_scenes.description: This scene provides emotional closure as Carrie finds comfort in her father's arms, who offers wisdom and reassurance about love and life, while Carrie reflects on her relief and lingering thoughts of Fred.

narrative_arcs.title: Father's Wisdom on Love and Life
Carrie's Relief and Reflection on Fred

sub_scenes.title: Town Encounter and Carrie's Confession to Dave
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts Carrie's encounter with Dave in town, where she finally confesses her enduring love for Fred despite everything, leading to an abrupt departure and unresolved tension.

sub_scenes.title: Reconciliation with Fred and Romantic Climax
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts Carrie's reconciliation with Fred, understanding his sacrifice, and their ultimate romantic reunion culminating in a marriage proposal and affectionate kiss.

narrative_arcs.title: Mr. Carlton's Arrival and Carrie's Misinterpretation
Revelation of Fred's Sacrifice and Brother's Intervention
Carrie's Emotional Awakening and Ride to Fred

Major_Arcs.title: Dirk and Rance - Brotherly Conflict and Resolution
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc centers around Dirk and Rance's conflict, Dirk's injury, and Rance's internal struggle between his duty as a Marshal and his loyalty to his brother, ultimately resolving in a complex emotional and legal reconciliation.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Injured Return and Dad's Concern
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts Dirk's injured return and his cryptic announcement, followed by the revelation of his gunshot wound and his father's growing concern and plan to investigate.

sub_scenes.title: Marshal Cready's Pursuit and Discovery of Dirk
sub_scenes.description: This scene introduces Marshal Rance Cready's arrival and pursuit of Dirk, leading to his confrontation with Chris and the discovery of Dirk's presence and injury at the ranch.

narrative_arcs.title: Marshal Rance Cready's Arrival and Initial Inquiry
Confirmation of Pursuit and Denial of Dirk's Presence
Rance Cready's Insistence and Proof of Dirk's Presence
Concern for Injured Dirk and Assertion of Law

sub_scenes.title: Reunion, Confession, and Escape Plan
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts the reunion of Chris and Rance, their emotional exchange and confession of love, followed by Chris proposing an escape plan for Dirk, testing Rance's loyalties.

narrative_arcs.title: Rejection of Excuse and Acknowledgment of Change
Argument, Confession and Confirmation of Love
Rance's Internal Conflict and Realization of Misjudgment
Rance's Decision, Departure Announcement and Realization of Manipulation

sub_scenes.title: Pursuit, Confrontation, and Shooting
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts the pursuit of Dirk and Chris, the confrontation with Marshal Rance Cready, the eruption of gunfire, and the immediate aftermath of the shooting, highlighting the violent climax of the chase.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern about the Marshal and Reassurance
Realization of Pursuit and Urgent Escape
Argument on Handling the Injured Person

sub_scenes.title: Escape, Reflection, and Romantic Proposal
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts Dirk's escape, Chris's reflective journey and realization of her love for Rance, and their reunion where Chris proposes marriage, resolving their romantic arc amidst the legal and moral complexities.

narrative_arcs.title: Forced Departure and Concern for the Injured
Woman's Reflection and Understanding of Love for Rance
Return to Rance and Confrontation about Injury
Father's Departure and Hint at Private Matters
Expression of Gratitude and Love Confession
Rance's Reflections on Marriage and Dirk
